Advice.heading: ViCase Tiny: When space is premium
Advice.content: Choose this case only when space is at an absolute premium. Examples would be wall-mount presentation screens where you mount ViCase Tiny between display and wall or under the screen. If you plan to place your ViCase behind your display on the table, consider ViCase Mini. It is taller, but you would not be able to see that anyways and for the same money you will get more options.

Advice.heading: ViCase Mini: The default choice
Advice.content: This is the standard housing that gets most jobs done. With 4L it is still tiny, yet offers lots of upgradeability options. ViCase Mini supports up to i7 quad core and two 2.5i drives. More than enough for most use cases.

Advice.heading: ViCase Ultra: The powerhouse
Advice.content: For the ultimate performance ViCase Ultra offers all of ViCase Mini with the following Step-Up Features

table1.name2: Build in with remote control option via ViCase Access and ViCase Access Plus
3 x DC Jack for 5.5 / 2.5 mm plug. Minus on outside. 12V. Current rating depends on the Pico Power you choose
CNC Grade Aluminum 6 mm thickness for case frame. Cover 2 mm thickness. All threads CNC cut Brass Inserts
Sandblasted, then anodized. 4 Colors available: Black, Natural, Blue, Red.
Yes, using V²A.Nano and ViDock G6
One mSATA SSD also known as Mini-SATA. Necessary mSATA Adapter, SATA Data Cable and SATA Power cable are included.
HDD are mounted with vibration and shock insulating rubber grommets.
mSATA mounting comes with thermal conductive double faced taped sponge. Heat of mSATA drive is transferred to Aluminum bottom cover that doubles as heat sink.

3 x DC Jack for 5.5 / 2.5 mm plug. Minus on outside. 12V. Current rating depends on the Pico Power you choose
Stereo Audio Out and Microphone Audio Input. Connected to Front Audio Panel on Motherboard
Takes the connector of ViCase Access option
If your mainboard supports WiFi these two holes can take the WiFi Antennae.
Compatible slot to secure the computer.
CNC Grade Aluminum 6 mm thickness for case frame. Cover 2 mm thickness. All threads CNC cut Brass Inserts
Sandblasted, then anodized. 4 Colors available: Black, Natural, Blue, Red.
Low Profile Height, Single Bracket width
Yes, both V²A Adapter with ViDock Nano G2 ... G6 and V²A.Nano with ViDock G6
2 Bays 2.5" Each bay can be populated either with mSATA Adapter or 2.5" Disk. Two SATA Data and two SATA Power Cables included. mSATA Adapter is optional.
HDD are mounted with vibration and shock insulating rubber grommets.
Case comes with thermal conductive sponge that transfers heat of disks to Aluminum bottom cover that doubles as heat sink.

table3.name2: Build in with remote control option via ViCase Access and ViCase Access Plus
3 x DC Jack for 5.5 / 2.5 mm plug. Minus on outside. 12V. Current rating depends on the Pico Power you choose
Stereo Audio Out and Microphone Audio Input. Connected to Front Audio Panel on Motherboard
Takes the connector of ViCase Access option
If your mainboard supports WiFi these two holes can take the WiFi Antennae.
Compatible slot to secure the computer.
CNC Grade Aluminum 6 mm thickness for case frame. Cover 2 mm thickness. All threads CNC cut Brass Inserts
Sandblasted, then anodized. 4 Colors available: Black, Natural, Blue, Red.
Low Profile Height, Triple Bracket width
Yes, both V²A Adapter with ViDock Nano G2 ... G6 and V²A.Nano with ViDock G6

Maximum number of 8 Bays. Each of the two bays under the Motherboard can be populated with either mSATA Adapter or 2.5" Disks.Two optional Disk Carrier are available. The 2.5" Disk Carrier can take up to 6 Disks. The 3.5" Disk carrier supports up to 3 disks.
HDD are mounted with vibration and shock insulating rubber grommets.

The two bay systems have two methods of cooling: 1) The disks under motherboard are use thermal conductive sponge that transfers heat of disks to Aluminum bottom cover that doubles as heat sink. 2) The Disk Carrier System comes with its own Fan and airflow guides. Fan speed can be regulated and monitored.

Advice.heading: Entry AMD
Advice.content: AM1 CPU have by far lowest cost and power consumption. But maximum performance is limited to about same performance as a high end tablet.

Advice.heading: Entry Intel
Advice.content: It works with 4th generation Intel Core processors in LGA 1150 architecture

Advice.heading: Mid Range
Advice.content: It have RAID5 and mPCIE which can connect wifi card

Advice.heading: High End
Advice.content: It have CPU overclock and M2 Disk,  this will have huge improvement for the PC performance
